bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John W. Hart, June 29, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks Hart for the information on the yellow fever experiments, however, none of the information was new to him.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John W. Hart, June 29, 1942
div1.opener:
June 29, 1942
Dr. John W. Hart
Winthrop Products, Inc.
170 Varick Street
New York City
My dear Doctor Hart:
div1.p:
Congratulations indeed on your elevation to
the vice presidency of your company. I know this must
give you great satisfaction and from what I have seen of
you, I would say that the vice presidency is now in very
able hands, meaning no offense to the previous vice
president.

Thank you for the information which Doctor
Stockman gave you. Most of it I knew. I have a copy
of the “Roll of Honor.” I spent a whole day with Doctor
Cook in Lexington about three weeks ago and I visited
Doctor Matas in New Orleans in January. I have the
Sternberg book and also the Lamson book. The latter
contains certain errors. Thank you for the note on the
philately of yellow fever. You remember my colored
slide of these stamps. I collected them after seeing
the interesting Winthrop advertisement.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
